entities module

class entities.Enemy(game, pos, size)[source]

Bases: PhysicsEntity

Represents an enemy entity with specific behaviors like patrolling or attacking the player.

Inherits from PhysicsEntity and adds enemy-specific attributes and methods.

walking

Counter for controlling patrolling behavior or other

Type:

int

movement patterns.
render(surf, offset=(0, 0))[source]

Renders the enemy entity on the specified surface, adjusted by the given offset and with additional enemy-specific visuals.

Parameters:

  • surf (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw the enemy on.

  • offset (tuple) – The offset to apply to the enemy’s position

  • drawing. (when)

update(tilemap, movement=(0, 0))[source]

Updates the enemy’s state, including patrolling behavior, attacks, and interactions with the player.

Parameters:

  • tilemap – The tilemap object the enemy interacts with.

  • movement (tuple) – The movement input for the enemy as (dx, dy).

class entities.PhysicsEntity(game, e_type, pos, size)[source]

Bases: object

A base class for entities in the game that interact physically with the world, including players, enemies, and other movable objects.

game

Reference to the main game object for accessing global resources and settings.

type

The type of the entity, used to distinguish between

Type:

str

different kinds of entities.
pos

The position of the entity in the game world as [x, y].

Type:

list

size

The size of the entity as (width, height).

Type:

tuple

velocity

The current velocity of the entity as [vx, vy].

Type:

list

collisions

A dictionary tracking collision states in four

Type:

dict

directions

‘up’, ‘down’, ‘left’, ‘right’.

action

The current action or state of the entity, affecting

Type:

str

its behavior and appearance.
anim_offset

Offset for the entity’s animation relative to

Type:

tuple

its position, as
Type:

offset_x, offset_y

flip

Indicates if the entity’s sprite should be flipped

Type:

bool

horizontally.
last_movement

The last movement input received, as [dx, dy],

Type:

list

influencing the entity's direction.
rect()[source]

Creates a pygame.Rect object representing the entity’s current position and size.

Returns:

The rectangle representing the entity’s bounds.

Return type:

pygame.Rect

render(surf, offset=(0, 0))[source]

Renders the entity on the specified surface, adjusted by the given offset and flipped based on the entity’s direction.

Parameters:

  • surf (pygame.Surface) – The surface to draw the entity on.

  • offset (tuple) – The offset to apply to the entity’s position when drawing.

set_action(action)[source]

Sets the current action of the entity, updating its animation accordingly.

Parameters:

action (str) – The new action to set for the entity.

update(tilemap, movement=(0, 0))[source]
Updates the entity’s state, including position, velocity, collisions,

and animation based on movement input and tilemap interactions.

Parameters:

  • tilemap – The tilemap object the entity interacts with.

  • movement (tuple) – The movement input for the entity as (dx, dy).

class entities.Player(game, pos, size)[source]

Bases: PhysicsEntity

Represents the player entity with specific behaviors like jumping, dashing, and interaction with game elements.

Inherits from PhysicsEntity and adds player-specific attributes and methods.

air_time

Counter for tracking how long the player has

Type:

int

been in the air
Type:

for jump control

jumps

The number of available jumps (for double jump

Type:

int

or similar mechanics).
wall_slide

Indicates whether the player is currently sliding down a wall.

Type:

bool

dashing

Counter for dash action, controlling its behavior

Type:

int

and duration.
dash()[source]

Initiates the player’s dash action, providing a burst of speed and potentially passing through obstacles.

jump()[source]

Initiates the player’s jump, affecting velocity and potentially enabling wall jumps or double jumps.

rect()[source]

Overrides the base method to provide a rectangle representing the player’s bounds for collision detection.

Returns:

The rectangle representing the player’s bounds.

Return type:

pygame.Rect

update(tilemap, movement=(0, 0))[source]
Updates the player’s state, including movement, jump, dash, and

interactions with the game world.

Parameters:

  • tilemap – The tilemap object the player interacts with.

  • movement (tuple) – The movement input for the player as (dx, dy).
